main event: A large, bright object was observed hovering in the sky near Cincinnati, Ohio, on 11 November 1957 for about 10-15 minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as larger than the moon and emitted no sound., The observer noted it was a bright silver object reflecting sunlight and causing local interest., Venus was very bright in the sky at the time, but the object was deemed too large to be Venus., The observation raised questions about whether it was a balloon, an aircraft, or something unknown., The event was clearly documented as part of Project Blue Book's investigation into UFOs.
sighted object: a large, bright object in the sky
witness description: One observer was a female aged 35, with another witness present at the time.
